outputs.output_descr: Running costs, rental cost, outreach activities and director's travel budget.

Core staffing of the governance assessment team to manage global programme effectively and deliver timely and substantively on support for country offices. Develop knowledge products that are seen as useful for country offices, in cooperation with DG advisers and other parts of UNDP [like BCPR]. Position UNDP convincingly in the global discourse on governance assessments, through knowledge projects that reflect the particular UNDP principles of engagement.
 Prepare the platform for a major outreach event that can attract the attention of major players from government, civil society, academia and media, to be hosted in Oslo.

Knowledge management frameworks, products and services support the policy, programming and project cycles. Increased engagement and participation of CSOs in planning and decision-making processes. Democratic governance improved through e-governance policies, and enhanced A2I and communications for development.
Dialouge on key policy areas, contribute to the UNDP Strategy on Transistions, policy-oriented research and review UN(DP) porgramming and comparative lessons compiled.
Inputs to metrics discussions provided, lessons from MDGs (DG/MDG9) compiled, DGG Global Governance work, Norwegian post-2015 consultations supported.
Support strenghtening of DG results management and governance data.
Private sector partnerships and fellowship programme.

Policy and Technical Support through field documentation. Advocacy and comparison of country cases and tools.
Business Case for Cross Practice Initiative. Policy and Technical Support through field documentation.
Foster gender sensitive lens to measurement of service delivery in OGC and UNDP policy and technical guidance to service delivery. 	Advocate for more gender sensitive and process oriented measurement of service delivery both within UNDP and to the outside. 	Enhance national ownership and capacity development of select countries (UNIFEM Program).

To support the implementation of the civil society strategy and promote concepts of social accountability in UNDP's work on democratic governance. To fill the vacuum for updated policy guidance on engaging with political parties. To contribute to policy development and mainstreaming of C4D as part of Access to Information work, by taking a leadership role in achieving the recommendation of the 11th UN Communication for Development Roundtable.  To strengthen the position of communication principles in national planning processes through a two-year pilot project.

Through the provision of demand driven knowledge products and tools, UN practitioners have better capacity to implement a human rights based approach to development.HuriTalk anchored firmly within the Knowledge Management pillar of the new Interagency Human Rights Mechanism.HuriTalk members are kept abreast of emerging human rights issues and have access to  the most relevant resources on HRBA, through the HuriTalk network products and Portal.HuriTalk smoothly transferred from Oslo to New York.

project_descr: Oslo Governance Centre DGTTF Funded Programmes
project_title: Oslo Governance Centre DGTTF Funded Programmes
